info.description: Manages Datasets in Aladdin Data Cloud (ADC). Used by Studio's ADC Admin Center.
info.title: Adc Dataset

get.description:
Gets an ADC Dataset matching the given criteria from the underlying data store.
(-- api-linter: core::0131::http-uri-id=disabled
aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because there is no unique identifier that helps us identify the ADC Dataset --)
Conforms to the 'idxPrimary' index found here https://dev.blackrock.com/adlvisualizer/?repositoryName=ADCDatasets&clientName=SHARED
URL: /adcDatasets?clientAbbreviation=dev&database=customdb&schema=public&datasetName=test_dataset&version=1.0.0

parameters.description: A unique identifier for this request.
parameters.name: VND.com.blackrock.Request-ID

parameters.description: Timestamp assigned to this request at origin, in "HTTP-date" format as defined by RFC 7231.
parameters.name: VND.com.blackrock.Origin-Timestamp

parameters.description:
Underlying database name for the Dataset
Value should be Upper Case only and follow the regex : ^[A-Z]+$.
parameters.name: datasetId.database

parameters.description:
Underlying schema name for the Dataset
(-- api-linter: core::0124::required-reference=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because this field is not related to the cross-domain schema field --)
(-- api-linter: aladdin::0901::dictionary-message-field=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because this field is not related to the cross-domain schema field --)
Value should be Upper Case only and follow the regex : ^[A-Z]+$.

aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because this field is not related to the cross-domain schema field --)

post.description:
This endpoint is intended for internal BlackRock use only and is in the process of being depreciated. 
Please refrain from using unless authorized.
Creates an ADC Dataset resource by adding entries to the underlying data store.
If a dataset already exists, return code AlreadyExists

delete.description:
Deletes the given ADC Dataset from the underlying data store. If the final version of the dataset is deleted,
it also deletes all the related objects from the data store. If dataset does not exist, return code NotFound.
The endpoint performs a hard delete.
If the dataset being deleted has associated views and stored procs, those would be deleted as well
(-- api-linter: core::0135::http-uri-id=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because there is no unique identifier that helps us identify the ADC Dataset --)

patch.description:
This endpoint is intended for internal BlackRock use only and is in the process of being depreciated. 
Please refrain from using unless authorized.
Updates the ADC Dataset matching the given criteria within the underlying data store.
If dataset does not already exist in ADL Repositories, return code NotFound.
(-- api-linter: core::0134::http-uri-id=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because there is no unique identifier that helps us identify the ADC Dataset --)

post.description:
This endpoint is intended for internal BlackRock use only and is in the process of being depreciated. 
Please refrain from using unless authorized.
Reconciles all ADC Datasets under ALADDINDB schema by comparing all properties within the 
ADCDataset for a given client against another gold-copy client.
The output is a list of datasets for which the recon executed successfully and did not execute successfully.
An email report is also sent to the provided email address for the reconciliation.

post.description:
Compares the registered column metadata of a data set in ADC to its corresponding view in the underlying data store. 
The column metadata fields reconciled are nullable, scale, precision and defaultValue. 
Any changes to the metadata in the underlying data store are overwritten in ADC. 
A successful operation refreshes column metadata for data sets registered with ADC. 
If input datasets are left empty in the request parameters, ADC will attempt to refresh registered datasets only. 
Unregistered data sets will not be considered.
In the case of a failure in operation, partially refreshed and failed datasets will be notified through the LongRunningOperation Status.
All (column metadata) changes trigger a major version increment to the dataset. 
When a major version increment occurs, the state of the previous version is changed from STATE_RELEASED to STATE_INACTIVE and the state of the new version is set to STATE_RELEASED. 
If no changes are identified, the version and state of a dataset are unaffected.
If new fields are identified as part of the refresh operation, column description will default to the following format: dataset_name:column_name
DataOwners, subscribers for a failed and success operation on a dataset will be notified via email with an id and current status of their request. 
The use of this operation requires the following : 
a) The user to have the "StudioAdmin" Aladdin Permission Type and "DATACLOUD" Aladdin Permission Group assigned in Aladdin Permissions
b) The user to have "Usage" and "Select" privileges on all the objects provided in the request (Usage on the database, Usage on the schema, and select on all views).
post.summary: Refresh schema (columnMetadata) of an ADC Dataset

post.description:
Initiates the registration process for registering dataset(s) in ADC. The API operation can be used to register custom or non-standard dataset(s).
In the case of a failure in operation, partially registered and failed datasets will be notified through the LongRunningOperation Status.
Default column descriptions is stored in the format : dataset_name:column_name
Default dataset description is stored as the fully qualified name for a dataset. 
If input datasets is left empty in the request parameters, a successful operation will register all views defined by database.schema references in the underlying data store to ADC.
Datasets are stored in STATE_RELEASED in ADC and indexed on Aladdin Studio.
The use of this operation requires "StudioAdmin" Aladdin perm assigned to the user and access to database and schema provided in request.

post.description:
This endpoint is intended for internal BlackRock use only and is in the process of being depreciated. 
Please refrain from using unless authorized.
Releases an ADC Dataset by executing DDLs in Snowflake which will create database objects 
such as table, views & stored procedure. Entries in ADL repo ADCDatasetReleaseHistory 
are also created to record the transaction.

patch.description:
Updates the latest "STATE_RELEASED" version of the DatasetFacet 
for each DatasetFacets provided under the selected Database & schema combination.
A successful execution of the request returns a list of DatasetFacets that were updated successfully.
While a failure in execution of the request returns a list of "Error" result objects 
containing the DatasetFacet and the error message corresponding to it. 
The use of this operation requires "StudioAdmin" Aladdin perm assigned to the user.
The update operation will be ATOMIC in nature, which means either all criteria 
fulfilling DatasetFacets will be updated or no DatasetFacets will be updated.
The update operation is only allowed simultaneously to either "columnMetadata"
or "columnMetadataDescription".
(-- api-linter: core::0234::http-method=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because this is how it's expected --)
(-- api-linter: aladdin::9048::rpc-name=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because this is how it's expected --)
(-- api-linter: core::0136::http-method=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because this is how it's expected --)

Any.description:
`Any` contains an arbitrary serialized message along with a
URL that describes the type of the serialized message

@type.description: A URL/resource name that uniquely identifies the type of the serialized message.

rpcStatus.description:
The `Status` type defines a logical error model that is suitable for
different programming environments, including REST APIs and RPC APIs. It is
used by [gRPC](https://github.com/grpc). Each `Status` message contains
three pieces of data: error code, error message, and error details.

You can find out more about this error model and how to work with it in the
[API Design Guide](https://cloud.google.com/apis/design/errors).

code.description: The status code, which should be an enum value of [google.rpc.Code][google.rpc.Code].

message.description:
A developer-facing error message, which should be in English. Any
user-facing error message should be localized and sent in the
[google.rpc.Status.details][google.rpc.Status.details] field, or localized by the client.

details.description:
A list of messages that carry the error details.  There is a common set of
message types for APIs to use.

v1AdcDataset.description:
An ADC Dataset resource maybe a current or past deployment of a table/view in Aladdin Data Cloud.
The resource describes a dataset's metadata and configuration details.

id.title: Id describes the computer or human assigned resource identifier. Here, dataset_name, client and version

clientAbbreviation.title:
Aladdin client environment abbreviation
Value should be Upper Case only and follow the regex : ^[A-Z]+$

version.title:
Version - ADC supports Semantic Versioning
(-- api-linter: aladdin::0901::dictionary-message-field=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because this field is not related to the cross-domain version field --)

Type of dataset - table / view

 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because this field is not related to the cross-domain dataset_type field --)

 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because this field is not related to the cross-domain description field --)

 - COLUMN_PROPERTY_SCALE: Relates to the column property : scale
 - COLUMN_PROPERTY_DEFAULT_VALUE: Relates to the column property : defaultValue

previousValue.title: previous value of the column property

A DatasetFacet consists of all the primary fields that an ADC Dataset contains
The resource describes a dataset's primary metadata properties.

autoSync.title: A boolean value that indicates if the metadata refresh is automatic or not

primaryKeys.title: List of primary keys for this Dataset

v1DatasetType.description:
- DATASET_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED: No type specified
 - DATASET_TYPE_TABLE: Type "table"
 - DATASET_TYPE_VIEW: Type "view"
 - DATASET_TYPE_HIST_VIEW: Type "hist view"
v1DatasetType.title: DatasetType describes the type of dataset represented by this resource

v1FailedAdcDatasetsResponse.title: The response of the operation in case of failue for longrunning AdcDatasetAPI.RefreshAdcDatasets and AdcDatasetAPI.RegisterAdcDatasets

v1FailedDatasetDetail.title: error detail associated with the failed dataset

Query used to filter ADC Datasets.

    fields before the Beta launch. --)

pageToken.description:
A page token, received from a previous 'FilterAdcDatasets' call.
Provide this to retrieve the subsequent page.

When paginating, all other parameters provided to
'FilterAdcDatasets' must match the call that provided the page
token.

pageSize.description:
The maximum number of ADC Datasets to return. The service may
return fewer than this value. If unspecified, at most 500
ADC Datasets will be returned. The maximum value is 500; values
above 500 will be coerced to 500.

adcDatasets.description: The entities that match the specified AdcDatasetsRequest.

nextPageToken.description:
A token, which can be sent as 'page_token' to retrieve the next page.
If this field is omitted, there are no subsequent pages.

v1IngestionFacet.title: A IngestionFacet consists of all the fields pertaining to the ingestion process

mergeEnabled.title: For a view, if input data files need to be merged

inputLocation.title: For a view, data input location

etlConfig.title:
For a view, ETL configuration
(-- api-linter: core::0144::message-field-plural=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this to match the correpsonding ADL repo that has the field name non plural --)

successEmails.title: Emails configured for success notifications on a successful data load event in ADC for a BlackRock managed pipeline

failureEmails.title: Emails configured for failure notifications on a failed data load event in ADC for a BlackRock managed pipeline

v1LongrunningOperation.description:
LongrunningOperation represents a long-running operation that is the result
of a network API call.

id.description:
The server-assigned id, which is only unique within the same service that
originally returns it. If you use the default HTTP mapping, the
`id` should have the format of `operations/some/unique/id`.

meta.description:
Service-specific metadata associated with the operation.  It typically
contains progress information and common metadata such as create time.
Some services might not provide such metadata.  Any method that returns a
long-running operation should document the metadata type, if any.

done.description:
If the value is `false`, it means the operation is still in progress.
If true, the operation is completed, and either `error` or `response` is
available.

error.description: The error result of the operation in case of failure or cancellation.

response.description:
The normal response of the operation in case of success.  If the original
method returns no data on success, such as `Delete`, the response is
`google.protobuf.Empty`.  If the original method is standard
`Get`/`Create`/`Update`, the response should be the resource.  For other
methods, the response should have the type `XxxResponse`, where `Xxx`
is the original method name.  For example, if the original method name
is `TakeSnapshot()`, the inferred response type is
`TakeSnapshotResponse`.

schema.title:
database schema to run reconciliation against
(-- api-linter: core::0124::required-reference=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because this field is not related to the cross-domain schema field --)
(-- api-linter: aladdin::0901::dictionary-message-field=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because this field is not related to the cross-domain schema field --)

emailAddresses.title: An array of email addresss to receive reconciliation report at

reconExecutedAdcDatasets.title: The list of datasets for which the reconciliations were executed

reconUnexecutedAdcDatasets.title: The list of datasets for which the reconciliations were not executed

reconException.title: Reason why the reconciliation wasn't executed for the datasets

v1RefreshActionDetail.title: Details of the refresh action performed on a dataset

addedColumns.title: Represents newly added columns from the previous registered version of an ADC Dataset

removedColumns.title: Represents removed columns from the previous registered version of an ADC Dataset

updatedColumns.title:
Represents updated columns from the previous registered version of an ADC Dataset
(-- api-linter: core::0142::time-field-names=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because this field does not represent a date/time value --)

datasetNames.title: Repeatable dataset names that are present in the database.schema reference in the underlying data store

v1RefreshAdcDatasetsSuccessResponse.title: The response of the operation in case of success for longrunning AdcDatasetAPI.RefreshAdcDatasets

refreshActionDetails.title: Details of a sucessfull refersh action

datasetNames.title: List of dataset names that belong to a specific database and schema

dataOwners.title:
Emails configured to identify data owners
(-- api-linter: aladdin::0901::forbidden-message-field=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because the underlying field is called data_owners ... --)
Provided list of data_owners will be applied to all datasets in the request.
Data Owners are required to successfully register any dataset to Aladdin Studio

category.title:
Business categorization of dataset (apart from Database and Schema) for use in Aladdin Studio
Provided category will be applied to all datasets in the request

autoSync.title: A boolean value that indicates if the background metadata refresh is set to automatic or not

v1RegisterAdcDatasetsSuccessResponse.title: The response of the operation in case of success for longrunning AdcDatasetAPI.RegisterAdcDatasets

registeredDatasetCount.title: Total count of registered ADC Datasets

datasetNames.title: Name of the registered ADC Datasets

v1SchemaId.title:
Composite key of database, schema to narrow down the operation
for the specific ADC Datasets

database.title: Underlying database name for the Dataset

schema.title:
Underlying schema name for the Dataset
(-- api-linter: core::0124::required-reference=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because this field is not related to the cross-domain schema field --)

 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because this field is not related to the cross-domain schema field --)

v1State.description:
- STATE_UNSPECIFIED: No state specified
 - STATE_DRAFT: In draft state, dataset owners may update the dataset details in Admin Center
 - STATE_REVIEW: In review state, dataset is ready for a 4-eyes check prior to release
 - STATE_APPROVED: In approved state, dataset is ready for a release
 - STATE_REJECTED: In rejected state, a dataset is not ready for release, and may be deleted or moved back to draft for edits
 - STATE_RELEASED: In released state, dataset is currently live in ADC Snowflake
 - STATE_INACTIVE: In inactive state, dataset entry exists in ADL repos, but is not currently deloyed in Snowflake
v1State.title: State describes the lifecycle state in which a dataset is currently in from ADC Admin Center context

v1TrackedAdcDatasetsMetadata.title:
Metadata for longrunning AdcDatasetAPI.RefreshAdcDatasets and AdcDatasetAPI.RegisterAdcDatasets
Sent as the metadata for LRO operations, register and refresh

trackedDatasetCount.title: Total count of datasets tracked to be refreshed in Aladdin Studio

datasetNames.title: Name of the tracked datasets to be refreshed in Aladdin Studio

v1UpdateDatasetFacetErrorResponse.title: The response message for AdcDatasetAPI.UpdateDatasetFacet error scenario

updateMask.description: List of fields to be updated.

v1UpdateDatasetFacetsResults.description:
The response message for oneof response types for AdcDatasetAPI.UpdateDatasetFacet
We need to provide success and error scenarios in result as EDC operations are not atomic in nature.

error.description: The error result of the operation in case of failure or cancellation.
